name: HE 2327-5642
notes: Radial velocity from median of measurements; excluding the 302.4 km/s outlier

name: BPS CS 22183-031
notes: Errors in teff/logg are systematic; error in metallicity is standard deviation in metallicity. Radial velocity from http://articles.adsabs.harvard.edu/cgi-bin/nph-iarticle_query?1992AJ....103.1987B&data_type=PDF_HIGH&whole_paper=YES&type=PRINTER&filetype=.pdf (ADS link: http://adsabs.harvard.edu/abs/1992AJ....103.1987B ) uncertainty guessed at 1 km/s

name: CS 29491-069
notes: Radial velocity taken from mean of -377.9; -376.3

name: HE 1219-0312
notes: Had to estimate radial velocity and error from Figure 1 of https://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/pdf/2009/35/aa11121-08.pdf

name: BPS CS 30306-132
notes: Errors in teff/logg are systematic. Christlieb et al. (2004) note that it could be a binary star. Has "actinide boost" (1 of 2 stars known as of 2004)

name: HD 221170
notes: Radial velocity from http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/sim-ref?bibcode=2008A%26A...480...91S  no companion detected after 14 years. Errors assumed  couldnt find them in Ivans et al. (2006)

name: HE 1523-0901
notes: Radial velocity from http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/sim-ref?bibcode=2006ApJ...652.1585F  radial velocity uncertainty is assumed

name: BPS CS 29497-004
notes: Actinide boost. Radial velocity from http://simbad.u-strasbg.fr/simbad/sim-ref?bibcode=2005A%26A...439..129B  assumed error on radial velocity

name: J203843.2-002333
notes: Radial velocity from RAVE DR4  there are two measurements (-638.5 +/- 14.9; -319.6 +/- 0.5)  took the latter.
